info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 3:46PM EDT until August 22 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following county, McCormick.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McCormick, Mccormick County Airport, Hamilton Branch State Park, Parksville, Plum Branch, Baker Creek State Park, Long Cane Creek Picnic Area, Hawe Creek Campground, Bordeaux, Whitetown, Willington, Leroy's Ferry Recreation Area, Mount Carmel, Modoc Boat Ramp, Modoc Campground, Modoc and Mount Carmel Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don't drown.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING
